intro: Hieracium sabaudum f. bladonii, commonly known as the Bladon’s Hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and is native to regions of Europe, including parts of the United Kingdom. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and often hairy. This form is a botanical variant of Hieracium sabaudum, distinguished by specific morphological traits.
